title: Using /tmp/gz_model.tar.gz Is not friendly for multi-user systems

content.raw:
We have had an issue where one user had previously ran Gazebo, which left a file: 
``/tmp/gz_model.tar.gz`` around. It looks like gazebo does not clean up this file after downloading a model from the web. 

This was preventing any subsequent user from downloading models from the online database, as it was failing with a permissions error. (A file already existed with that name but owned by another user) We were able to resolve this by having an administrator remove the offending file. 

I originally thought this was caused by gazebo crashing (or being shut down) while it was downloading a model, but after checking just about every one of our shared machines had a ``/tmp/gz_model.tar.gz`` I believe that it is a more commonplace problem than I originally thought. 

Please let me know if this description is unclear.
